description.zh-cn: 中国共产党元老宋任穷之女，文化大革命期间北京师范大学女附中的红卫兵领袖。因在北京“红八月”期间，其所在学校的副校长卞仲耘被打死，以及她为毛泽东佩戴红卫兵袖章而闻名。后移居美国，晚年就文革行为道歉但引发争议。
description.en: Daughter of CCP elder Song Renqiong and a Red Guard leader at the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University during the Cultural Revolution. She became famous for the death of the school's vice-principal, Bian Zhongyun, during Beijing's 'Red August' and for putting a Red Guard armband on Mao Zedong. She later immigrated to the United States and apologized for her actions during the Cultural Revolution in her later years, which sparked controversy.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党元老、中国人民解放军开国上将，宋彬彬之父。
description.en: A founding elder of the Communist Party of China, a founding general of the People's Liberation Army, and the father of Song Binbin.

description.zh-cn: 宋任穷的妻子，宋彬彬之母。
description.en: Wife of Song Renqiong and mother of Song Binbin.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会主席，文化大革命的发动者。
description.en: Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and initiator of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的在中国发生的政治运动，对中国社会造成了深远的影响。宋彬彬是该运动中红卫兵的代表人物之一。
description.en: A political movement in China initiated and led by Mao Zedong, which had a profound impact on Chinese society. Song Binbin was one of the representative figures of the Red Guards during this movement.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，中国各地青年学生自发组成的群众性组织。
description.en: Mass organizations spontaneously formed by young students across China during the Cultural Revolution.

nodes.id: 北京师范大学附属实验中学

zh-cn: 北京师范大学附属实验中学
en: The Experimental High School Attached to Beijing Normal University

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬就读的中学，也是卞仲耘遇害的地点。
description.en: The middle school attended by Song Binbin and the location where Bian Zhongyun was killed.

description.zh-cn: 北京师范大学女附中的党总支书记兼副校长，在1966年“红八月”期间被该校红卫兵批斗致死。
description.en: Party Secretary and Vice Principal of the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University, who was beaten to death by the school's Red Guards during a struggle session in 'Red August' of 1966.

description.zh-cn: 指1966年8月，北京的红卫兵运动进入高潮，发生大规模批斗、抄家、暴力攻击等事件。卞仲耘在此期间遇害。
description.en: Refers to August 1966, when the Red Guard movement in Beijing reached its peak, involving large-scale struggle sessions, home raids, and violent attacks. Bian Zhongyun was killed during this period.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬的出生地。1949年后改称北京。
description.en: Song Binbin's birthplace. Renamed Beijing after 1949.

description.zh-cn: 美国城市，宋彬彬的逝世地。
description.en: A city in the United States where Song Binbin passed away.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬于1980年留学并入籍的国家。
description.en: The country where Song Binbin studied abroad and became a citizen in 1980.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华人民共和国主席，文革初期曾批准成立工作组，后被打倒。
description.en: Then-Chairman of the People's Republic of China, who approved the establishment of work groups in the early stage of the Cultural Revolution and was later purged.

description.zh-cn: 时任中共中央书记处负责人，文革初期曾批准成立工作组，后被打倒。
description.en: Then-head of the Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee, who approved the establishment of work groups in the early stage of the Cultural Revolution and was later purged.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命初期，由刘少奇、邓小平等派出，进驻各单位领导运动的组织，后被毛泽东批评并撤销。
description.en: Organizations dispatched by Liu Shaoqi, Deng Xiaoping, and others at the beginning of the Cultural Revolution to lead the movement in various units. They were later criticized by Mao Zedong and withdrawn.

description.zh-cn: 刘仰峤之女，文革期间北京师范大学女附中的学生领袖，与宋彬彬一同担任革命师生代表会领导。
description.en: Daughter of Liu Yangqiao, a student leader at the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University during the Cultural Revolution, who served as a leader of the Revolutionary Teachers and Students' Representative Council alongside Song Binbin.

description.zh-cn: 时任中共北京市委第二书记，宋彬彬曾向他报告卞仲耘的死讯。
description.en: Then-Second Secretary of the Beijing Municipal Committee of the CPC, to whom Song Binbin reported the death of Bian Zhongyun.

en: Mao Zedong's reception of the Red Guards

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月18日，毛泽东在天安门广场首次接见来自全国各地的红卫兵。在这次活动中，宋彬彬为毛泽东戴上了红卫兵袖章。
description.en: On August 18, 1966, Mao Zedong received Red Guards from all over the country for the first time in Tiananmen Square. During this event, Song Binbin put a Red Guard armband on Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 中共高级官员，曾接见宋彬彬并动员她前往武汉。
description.en: A senior CPC official who met with Song Binbin and mobilized her to go to Wuhan.

en: Hubei Provincial Committee of the CPC

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党在湖北省的领导机关。宋彬彬曾受王任重动员前往武汉保卫该组织。
description.en: The leading body of the Communist Party of China in Hubei Province. Song Binbin was once mobilized by Wang Renzhong to go to Wuhan to defend this organization.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的妻子，中央文革小组核心成员。曾在大会上批评宋任穷及其女儿宋彬彬。
description.en: Mao Zedong's wife and a core member of the Central Cultural Revolution Group. She criticized Song Renqiong and his daughter Song Binbin at a conference.

description.zh-cn: 中国辽宁省省会。1968年4月，宋彬彬和其母亲被押至此地软禁。
description.en: The capital of Liaoning Province, China. In April 1968, Song Binbin and her mother were taken here and placed under house arrest.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬在1972年作为工农兵学员就读的大学。
description.en: The university Song Binbin attended as a Worker-Peasant-Soldier student in 1972.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国波士顿的大学，宋彬彬于1983年在此获得地球化学专业硕士学位。
description.en: A university in Boston, USA, where Song Binbin obtained her master's degree in geochemistry in 1983.

description.zh-cn: 位于美国麻萨诸塞州的大学，宋彬彬于1989年在此获得地球化学博士学位。
description.en: A university in Massachusetts, USA, where Song Binbin obtained her PhD in geochemistry in 1989.

description.zh-cn: 卞仲耘的丈夫，拒绝接受宋彬彬的道歉。
description.en: The husband of Bian Zhongyun, who refused to accept Song Binbin's apology.

description.zh-cn: 文革研究者，其文章指控宋彬彬对卞仲耘之死负有责任。
description.en: A researcher of the Cultural Revolution whose writings accused Song Binbin of being responsible for the death of Bian Zhongyun.

description.zh-cn: 美国女学者，其研究文章称宋彬彬对文革初期的暴力活动负有责任。
description.en: An American female scholar whose research article states that Song Binbin was responsible for violent activities in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬是宋任穷的女儿。
description.en: Song Binbin is the daughter of Song Renqiong.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬是锺月林的女儿。
description.en: Song Binbin is the daughter of Zhong Yuelin.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬于1947年出生于北平市。
description.en: Song Binbin was born in Beiping in 1947.

relationships.target: 北京师范大学附属实验中学

description.zh-cn: 1960年至1966年就读于北京师范大学女附中。
description.en: Studied at the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University from 1960 to 1966.

description.zh-cn: 文革期间是北京师范大学女附中红卫兵领袖。
description.en: Was a Red Guard leader at the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 在北京“红八月”期间，宋彬彬率领的北京师范大学女附中红卫兵将副校长卞仲耘批斗致死。
description.en: During the 'Red August' in Beijing, Red Guards from the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University, led by Song Binbin, beat vice-principal Bian Zhongyun to death during a struggle session.

description.zh-cn: 1966年“红八月”期间，北京师范大学女附中副校长卞仲耘被红卫兵批斗致死。
description.en: During the 'Red August' of 1966, Bian Zhongyun, the vice-principal of the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University, was beaten to death by Red Guards during a struggle session.

description.zh-cn: 在天安门城楼上为毛泽东戴上红卫兵袖章。
description.en: Put a Red Guard armband on Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen Rostrum.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在天安门城楼上对宋彬彬说“要武嘛”，使其名声大噪，并一度改名“宋要武”。
description.en: Mao Zedong told Song Binbin on the Tiananmen Rostrum 'We need to be militant' (要武嘛), which made her famous and led her to temporarily change her name to 'Song Yaowu' (Song who wants to be militant).

description.zh-cn: 在毛泽东首次接见红卫兵的活动中，宋彬彬因给毛泽东戴上袖章并与之交谈而闻名全国。
description.en: During Mao Zedong's first reception of the Red Guards, Song Binbin became famous nationwide for putting an armband on Mao and speaking with him.

description.zh-cn: 批准成立文化大革命工作组。
description.en: Approved the establishment of the Cultural Revolution Work Groups.

description.zh-cn: 批准成立文化大革命工作组。
description.en: Approved the establishment of the Cultural Revolution Work Groups.

description.zh-cn: 批评刘少奇、邓小平派出工作组的做法，导致工作组被撤销。
description.en: Criticized the practice of Liu Shaoqi and Deng Xiaoping of sending out work groups, leading to their withdrawal.

description.zh-cn: 在工作组领导下，宋彬彬成为北京师大女附中革命师生代表会副主席之一。
description.en: Under the leadership of the work group, Song Binbin became one of the vice-chairpersons of the Revolutionary Teachers and Students' Representative Council at the Girls' High School Attached to Beijing Normal University.

description.zh-cn: 在卞仲耘被打死当晚，宋彬彬等人向时任中共北京市委第二书记吴德报告其死因。
description.en: On the evening Bian Zhongyun was beaten to death, Song Binbin and others reported the cause of her death to Wu De, who was then the Second Secretary of the Beijing Municipal Committee of the CPC.

description.zh-cn: 在一次大会上公开批评宋彬彬前往武汉保卫中共湖北省委的行为，此事导致宋家失势。
description.en: At a conference, publicly criticized Song Binbin's action of going to Wuhan to defend the Hubei Provincial Committee of the CPC, which led to the downfall of the Song family.

description.zh-cn: 在一次大会上公开批评宋任穷及其女儿，导致宋家被批斗和失势。
description.en: Publicly criticized Song Renqiong and his daughter at a conference, which led to the Song family being struggled against and losing power.

description.zh-cn: 王晶垚是卞仲耘的丈夫。
description.en: Wang Jingyao was the husband of Bian Zhongyun.

description.zh-cn: 作为卞仲耘的丈夫，王晶垚发表声明拒绝接受宋彬彬的道歉，称其虚伪。
description.en: As the husband of Bian Zhongyun, Wang Jingyao issued a statement refusing to accept Song Binbin's apology, calling it hypocritical.

description.zh-cn: 在其文章中首次将卞仲耘之死与宋彬彬联系起来，并指控宋彬彬是事件的负责人。
description.en: In her writings, she was the first to link the death of Bian Zhongyun to Song Binbin and accused Song of being responsible for the incident.

description.zh-cn: 在其研究文章中引用王友琴的观点，称宋彬彬对文革初期的暴力活动负有责任。
description.en: In her research article, she cited Wang Youqin's views, stating that Song Binbin was responsible for violent activities in the early stages of the Cultural Revolution.
